notes.claim: A report’s main purpose is to present facts, and effective reports are concise, well-structured, and visually engaging using headings, bullet points, and visuals; clear, direct language helps convey key insights.
notes.support: "The main idea of a report is to present facts about a specific topic, situation, or event... Regardless of type, an effective report is concise, well-structured, and visually engaging, using headings, bullet points, and visuals. Clear, direct language ensures key insights are effectively conveyed."

notes.claim: There are six main types of reports: annual, weekly, project, sales and marketing, research, and academic.
notes.support: "There are six main types of reports: annual reports, weekly reports, project reports, sales and marketing reports, research reports and academic reports."

notes.claim: A standard report format includes key sections: title page, executive summary, introduction, findings, conclusion, recommendations, and appendices.
notes.support: "A report format structures information clearly with key sections like a title page, executive summary, introduction, findings, conclusion, recommendations and appendices."

notes.claim: Different report focuses: business reports emphasize financials, research reports analyze findings, and technical reports explain processes.
notes.support: "Business reports focus on financials, research reports analyze findings, and technical reports explain processes."

notes.claim: Annual reports can include detailed financial statements, market analysis, key performance indicators, and strategic plans; charts and graphs help make the data easier to understand.
notes.support: "In an annual report, you can include detailed financial statements, market analysis, key performance indicators and strategic plans for the upcoming year. To make the data easier to understand, you can include visual aids like charts and graphs."

notes.claim: Tesla’s Impact Report is cited as a strong example: clear title, table of contents, introduction, varied visuals (charts and graphs), and a recommendations section.
notes.support: "Tesla's Impact Report is an excellent example... It's well-structured and easy to read, with a clear title, table of contents and introduction. The report also includes a variety of visuals, such as charts and graphs... Additionally, the report includes a section on recommendations..."

notes.claim: Weekly reports typically include completed tasks, current projects, potential obstacles, and priorities for the upcoming week.
notes.support: "Weekly reports usually include information on completed tasks, current projects, potential obstacles and priorities for the upcoming week."

notes.claim: Weekly reports foster alignment and transparency, provide a snapshot of progress, identify roadblocks early, maintain focus on objectives, promote accountability, and enable data-driven decisions.
notes.support: "Weekly reports are an essential tool for fostering team alignment and maintaining transparency. They provide a snapshot of progress, help identify roadblocks early, and ensure everyone stays focused on shared objectives... by promoting accountability and enabling data-driven decision-making." — Krystyna Bodlieva

notes.claim: Project reports commonly include objectives, task lists, milestones, risk assessments, and budget analysis; Gantt charts illustrate timelines and dependencies to keep stakeholders informed of status.
notes.support: "Some of the key elements of a project report are project objectives, task lists, milestones, risk assessments and budget analysis. One of the most common visual representations a project report includes is the Gantt chart. You can use this chart to illustrate project timelines and dependencies and ensure that all the stakeholders know the project's status."

notes.claim: Sales/marketing reports use graphs to show profit margins and engagement increases and help determine whether strategies are working or need tweaking.
notes.support: "Put together graphs showing profit margins, increases in engagement and more. These types of reports are also a great way to determine whether your strategies are working or if they need some tweaking in the future."

notes.claim: Visme offers hundreds of pre-made report templates and an online report maker to create high-quality reports across any niche, topic, or industry.
notes.support: "Visme offers not only hundreds of pre-made report templates but an initiative online report maker to provide you with everything you need to create high-quality reports for any niche, topic or industry."

notes.claim: Visme provides easy-to-edit report templates that can be edited, shared, and downloaded.
notes.support: "Here's a short selection of 6 easy-to-edit report templates you can edit, share and download with Visme."

notes.claim: An expert approach to sales reporting includes importing data into Visme to build a simple visual narrative with charts, graphs, and data widgets; adding callouts and interactive pop-ups for drill-down; and anticipating audience questions.
notes.support: "I pull my data points, and get things into Visme to present a better visual narrative. I keep the views simple with Visme’s charts, graphs, and data widgets… I then bring in call out visuals and interactive pop-ups that drill into things more from the simple views — achieving the ‘drill down’. Golden ticket is to try to predict the questions that will come up..." — Kalyn Lewis

notes.claim: Top report writing tips: create an outline, draft the body before the introduction or conclusion, stick to facts, and keep the appendix at a reasonable size.
notes.support: "Top report writing tips include writing a report outline, creating the body of the report before the introduction or conclusion, sticking to facts, and keeping your appendix at a reasonable size."

notes.claim: A report format communicates data and insights for decision-making in business, research, or academia; good organization enhances clarity, professionalism, and readability.
notes.support: "It communicates data and insights for decision-making in business, research, or academia. A well-organized report enhances clarity, professionalism, and readability."
